InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify the Instance ID for the SQL Server features you have specified. SQL Server directory structure, registry structure, and service names will reflect the instance ID of the SQL Server instance.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify the Instance ID for the SQL Server features you have specified. SQL Server directory structure, registry structure, and service names will reflect the instance ID of the SQL Server instance.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify the SQL Server product key to configure which edition you would like to use.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify the SQL Server product key to configure which edition you would like to use.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies a Setup work flow, like INSTALL, UNINSTALL, or UPGRADE. This is a required parameter.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies a Setup work flow, like INSTALL, UNINSTALL, or UPGRADE. This is a required parameter.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies a Setup main workflow, like INSTALL, UNINSTALL, or UPGRADE.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies a Setup work flow, like INSTALL, UNINSTALL, or UPGRADE. This is a required parameter.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the configuration file to be used for Setup.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the configuration file to be used for Setup.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Allows the debugging session to be attached.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Allows the debugging session to be attached.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies one or more instrumented Setup code locations to trigger artificial failures.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies one or more instrumented Setup code locations to trigger artificial failures.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies that any failpoint failures will be treated as regular errors.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies that any failpoint failures will be treated as regular errors.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the limit of the number of any failpoint failures.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the limit of the number of any failpoint failures.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies features to install, uninstall, or upgrade. The list of top-level features include SQL, AS, RS, IS, and Tools. The SQL feature will install the database engine, replication, and full-text. The Tools feature will install Management Tools, Books online, Business Intelligence Development Studio, and other shared components.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies features to install, uninstall, or upgrade. The list of top-level features include SQL, AS, RS, IS, and Tools. The SQL feature will install the database engine, replication, and full-text. The Tools feature will install Management Tools, Books online, Business Intelligence Development Studio, and other shared components.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Displays the command line parameters usage
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Displays the command line parameters usage

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies that the detailed Setup log should be piped to the console.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies that the detailed Setup log should be piped to the console.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the path to the installation media.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the path to the installation media.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument LOGMARKER has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument LOGMARKER has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Setup will not display any user interface.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Setup will not display any user interface.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Setup will display progress only without any user interaction.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Setup will display progress only without any user interaction.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument NOMUTEX has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument NOMUTEX has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the list of rule IDs or rule group IDs to run.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the list of rule IDs or rule group IDs to run.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies that Setup should install into WOW64. This command line argument is not supported on an IA64 or a 32-bit system.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies that Setup should install into WOW64. This command line argument is not supported on an IA64 or a 32-bit system.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument TIMESTAMP has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument TIMESTAMP has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the list of rules to skip.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the list of rules to skip.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument MEDIALAYOUT has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument MEDIALAYOUT has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument CUPIDDISPLAYED has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument CUPIDDISPLAYED has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the path to the installation media folder where setup.exe is located.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the path to the installation media folder where setup.exe is located.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument HIDECONSOLE has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument HIDECONSOLE has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument PATCHSQLSUPPORT has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument PATCHSQLSUPPORT has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Detailed help for command line argument IGNORESERVICERESTARTSTATE has not been defined yet.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Detailed help for command line argument IGNORESERVICERESTARTSTATE has not been defined yet.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies that SQL Server Setup should not manage the SQL Server services. This option should only be used in a non-Microsoft cluster environment.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies that SQL Server Setup should not manage the SQL Server services. This option should only be used in a non-Microsoft cluster environment.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies that all instances are to be included in the Setup operation. This parameter is only supported when applying a patch.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies that all instances are to be included in the Setup operation. This parameter is only supported when applying a patch.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the set of instances to be included in the Setup operation. This parameter is only supported when applying a patch.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the set of instances to be included in the Setup operation. This parameter is only supported when applying a patch.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify that upgrade scripts should be copied from the previous Setup operation.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify that upgrade scripts should be copied from the previous Setup operation.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify if errors can be reported to Microsoft to improve future SQL Server releases. Specify 1 or True to enable and 0 or False to disable this feature.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify if errors can be reported to Microsoft to improve future SQL Server releases. Specify 1 or True to enable and 0 or False to disable this feature.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify the root installation directory for native shared components.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify the root installation directory for native shared components.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify the root installation directory for the WOW64 shared components.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify the root installation directory for the WOW64 shared components.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify the installation directory.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify the instance root directory.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify that SQL Server feature usage data can be collected and sent to Microsoft. Specify 1 or True to enable and 0 or False to disable this feature.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify that SQL Server feature usage data can be collected and sent to Microsoft. Specify 1 or True to enable and 0 or False to disable this feature.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify a default or named instance. MSSQLSERVER is the default instance for non-Express editions and SQLExpress for Express editions. This parameter is required when installing the SQL Server Database Engine (SQL), Analysis Services (AS), or Reporting Services (RS).
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify a default or named instance. MSSQLSERVER is the default instance for non-Express editions and SQLExpress for Express editions. This parameter is required when installing the SQL Server Database Engine (SQL), Analysis Services (AS), or Reporting Services (RS).

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies a cluster shared disk to associate with the SQL Server failover cluster instance.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies a cluster shared disk to associate with the SQL Server failover cluster instance.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the name of the cluster group for the SQL Server failover cluster instance.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the name of the cluster group for the SQL Server failover cluster instance.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies an encoded IP address. The encodings are semicolon-delimited (;), and follow the format <IP Type>;<address>;<network name>;<subnet mask>. Supported IP types include DHCP, IPV4, and IPV6.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies an encoded IP address. The encodings are semicolon-delimited (;), and follow the format <IP Type>;<address>;<network name>;<subnet mask>. Supported IP types include DHCP, IPV4, and IPV6.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies whether the upgraded nodes should take ownership of the failover instance group or not. Use 0 to retain ownership in the legacy nodes, 1 to make the upgraded nodes take ownership, or 2 to let SQL Server Setup decide when to move ownership.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies whether the upgraded nodes should take ownership of the failover instance group or not. Use 0 to retain ownership in the legacy nodes, 1 to make the upgraded nodes take ownership, or 2 to let SQL Server Setup decide when to move ownership.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the name of the SQL Server failover cluster instance. This name is the network name that is used to connect to SQL Server services.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the name of the SQ LServer failover cluster instance. This name is the network name that is used to connect to SQL Server services.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Agent account name
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Either domain user name or system account

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Password for Agent account.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Password for domain user name. Not required for system account

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Auto-start service after installation.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Either 1 or 0

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Agent account name
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Either domain user name or system account

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Integration Services password, required for a domain account only.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Password for domain user.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Startup type for Integration Services.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Automatic, Manual or Disabled.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Account for Integration Services: Domain\User or system account.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Either domain user name or system account.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The name of the account that the Analysis Services service runs under.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The account used by the Analysis Services service.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The password for the Analysis Services service account.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The password for the Analysis Services service account.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Controls the service startup type setting after the service has been created.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Controls the service startup type setting for the service.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The collation to be used by Analysis Services.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The collation used by Analysis Services.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The location for the Analysis Services data files.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The location for the Analysis Services data files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The location for the Analysis Services log files.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The location for the Analysis Services log files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The location for the Analysis Services backup files.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The location for the Analysis Services backup files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The location for the Analysis Services temporary files.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The location for the Analysis Services temporary files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The location for the Analysis Services configuration files.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The location for the Analysis Services configuration files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies whether or not the MSOLAP provider is allowed to run in process.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies if the MSOLAP provider can run in process.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the list of administrator accounts that need to be provisioned.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the list of administrator accounts to provision.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the Analysis Services domain group name.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the Analysis Services domain group name.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Startup type for the SQL Server service.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Startup type for the SQL Server service.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Level to enable FILESTREAM feature at (0, 1, 2 or 3).
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Level to enable FILESTREAM feature at (0, 1, 2 or 3).

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Name of Windows share to be created for FILESTREAM File I/O.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Name of Windows share to be created for FILESTREAM File I/O.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Set to "1" to enable RANU for SQL Server Express.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Set to "1" to enable RANU for SQL Server Express.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies a Windows collation or an SQL collation to use for the Database Engine.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies a Windows collation or an SQL collation to use for the Database Engine.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Password for SQL Server sa account.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Password for SQL Server sa account.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Domain group name for Windows Server 2003 failover instance.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Domain group name for Windows Server 2003 failover instance.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Account for SQL Server service: Domain\User or system account.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Account for SQL Server service: Domain\User or system account.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: A SQL Server service password is required only for a domain account.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: A SQL Server service password is required only for a domain account.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Windows account(s) to provision as SQL Server system administrators.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Windows account(s) to provision as SQL Server system administrators.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The default is Windows Authentication. Use "SQL" for Mixed Mode Authentication.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The default is Windows Authentication. Use "SQL" for Mixed Mode Authentication.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: The Database Engine root data directory.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The Database Engine root data directory.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Default directory for the Database Engine backup files.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Default directory for the Database Engine backup files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Default directory for the Database Engine user databases.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Default directory for the Database Engine user databases.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Default directory for the Database Engine user database logs.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Default directory for the Database Engine user database logs.

InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Directory for Database Engine TempDB files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Directory for the Database Engine TempDB log files.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Directory for the Database Engine TempDB log files.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Provision current user as a Database Engine system administrator for SQL Server 2008 Express.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Provision current user as a Database Engine system administrator for SQL Server 2008 Express.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify 0 to disable or 1 to enable the TCP/IP protocol.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify 0 to disable or 1 to enable the TCP/IP protocol.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specify 0 to disable or 1 to enable the Named Pipes protocol.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify 0 to disable or 1 to enable the Named Pipes protocol.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Startup type for Browser Service.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Startup type for Browser Service.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies which account the report server NT service should execute under. When omitted or when the value is empty string, the default built-in account for the current operating system. The username part of RSSVCACCOUNT is a maximum of 20 characters long and The domain part of RSSVCACCOUNT is a maximum of 254 characters long.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify the service account of the report server. This value is required. If you omit this value, Setup will use the default built-in account for the current operating system (either NetworkService or LocalSystem). If you specify a domain user account, the domain must be under 254 characters and the user name must be under 20 characters. The account name cannot contain the following characters: " / \ [ ] : ; | = , + * ? < >

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies which password for the account the report server NT service should execute under.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify a strong password for the account. A strong password is at least 8 characters and includes a combination of upper and lower case alphanumeric characters and at least one symbol character. Avoid spelling an actual word or name that might be listed in a dictionary.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies how the startup mode of the report server NT service. When Manual - Service startup is manual mode (default). Automatic - Service startup is automatic mode. Disabled - Service is disabled
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the startup mode for the Report Server service. Valid values include Manual, Automatic, and Disabled. The default value for StartupType is Manual, where the server is started when a request is received.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies which mode report server is installed in. Default value: “FilesOnly”
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specifies the installation mode for the report server. Valid values include Default, DefaultSharePoint, and FilesOnly. The default value for InstallMode is FilesOnly.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies which account to use to access the exisiting report server catalog database during the upgrade. When omitted or when the value is empty string, the default built-in account for the current operating system. The username part of RSUPGRADEDATABASEACCOUNT is a maximum of 20 characters long and The domain part of RSUPGRADEDATABASEACCOUNT is a maximum of 254 characters long.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify the account used to access the existing report server catalog database. This value is required. If you omit this value, Setup will use the default built-in account for the current operating system (either NetworkService or LocalSystem). If you specify a domain user account, the domain must be under 254 characters and the user name must be under 20 characters. The account name cannot contain the following characters: " / \ [ ] : ; | = , + * ? < >

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies which password for the account used to access the exisiting report server catalog database.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify a strong password for the account. A strong password is at least 8 characters and includes a combination of upper and lower case alphanumeric characters and at least one symbol character. Avoid spelling an actual word or name that might be listed in a dictionary.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies which password for the account used to access the exisiting report server catalog database.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Specify a strong password for the account. A strong password is at least 8 characters and includes a combination of upper and lower case alphanumeric characters and at least one symbol character. Avoid spelling an actual word or name that might be listed in a dictionary.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Specifies the SQL Server server that contains the report server catalog database.
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: The SQL Server server for the report server catalog database.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Add description of input argument FTSVCACCOUNT
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: User account for Full-text Filter Daemon Host.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Add description of input argument FTSVCPASSWORD
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: User password for Full-text Filter Daemon Host account.

InputSettingInfo.configFileDescription: Add description of input argument FTUPGRADEOPTION
InputSettingInfo.cmdLineUsage: Full-text catalog upgrade option.
